SEARCH
Package librarySE.managers

Class ItemManager

java.lang.Object
librarySE.managers.ItemManager
public class ItemManager extends Object
The ItemManager class manages all LibraryItem objects in the system, such as books, CDs, and journals.

This class is implemented as a Singleton to ensure that only one instance exists throughout the application lifecycle.

It provides administrative operations (e.g., add and delete items) and general operations (e.g., search and retrieve all items).

When a new item is added, all registered users are automatically notified via email using the EmailNotifier utility.

Data persistence is handled by the injected ItemRepository implementation, while searching behavior is delegated to the injected SearchStrategy instance. Thread safety is achieved using a CopyOnWriteArrayList for concurrent access.

Design Patterns used: Singleton, Strategy, and Observer (via Email notifications).

Author:
Eman

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static ItemManager init(ItemRepository repo, SearchStrategy search)
      Initializes the ItemManager singleton instance.

      Must be called once at system startup, typically in the main initialization phase.

      Parameters:
      repo - the ItemRepository instance used to persist data
      search - the SearchStrategy instance used for search logic
      Returns:
      the initialized singleton instance

    • getInstance

      public static ItemManager getInstance()
      Retrieves the current ItemManager singleton instance.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if init(ItemRepository, SearchStrategy) has not been called first

    • setSearchStrategy

      public void setSearchStrategy(SearchStrategy s)
      Updates the current SearchStrategy used for item searches.
      Parameters:
      s - the new SearchStrategy to be used

    • addItem

      public void addItem(LibraryItem item, Admin admin)
      Adds a new LibraryItem to the system.

      Only administrators are authorized to perform this operation. Once the item is added, all registered users are notified via email.

      Parameters:
      item - the LibraryItem to add; must not be null
      admin - the Admin performing the operation; must not be null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if item or admin is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the admin does not have sufficient privileges

    • deleteItem

      public void deleteItem(LibraryItem item, Admin admin)
      Deletes an existing LibraryItem from the system.

      Only administrators are authorized to perform this operation.

      Parameters:
      item - the LibraryItem to remove; must not be null
      admin - the Admin performing the operation; must not be null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if item or admin is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the admin does not have sufficient privileges

    • searchItems

      public List<LibraryItem> searchItems(String keyword)
      Searches for items that match the provided keyword.

      The search is case-insensitive and uses the configured SearchStrategy.

      Parameters:
      keyword - the search keyword; must not be null
      Returns:
      a list of LibraryItem objects matching the keyword; returns an empty list if no results are found
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if keyword is null

    • getAllItems

      public List<LibraryItem> getAllItems()
      Retrieves all LibraryItem objects currently available in the system.

      Returns an unmodifiable copy to prevent external modification of the internal list.

      Returns:
      an immutable list containing all library items

    • saveAll

      public void saveAll()
      Persists the current list of items to the underlying repository.

      Call this after GUI edit operations (e.g. changing title, price, or copies) to flush all changes to the JSON file.
